contentrichtext.text: '''Ben-Hur''' may refer to: {{TOC right}} ==Fiction== *''[[Ben-Hur: A Tale of the Christ]]'' is an 1880 novel by American general and author Lew Wallace ** [[Ben Hur (1907 film)|''Ben Hur'' (1907 film)]], a one-reel silent version ** [[Ben-Hur (1925 film)|''Ben-Hur'' (1925 film)]], an MGM silent film starring Ramon Novarro ** [[Ben-Hur (1959 film)|''Ben-Hur'' (1959 film)]], an MGM sound film starring Charlton Heston that won 11 Academy Awards ** [[Ben Hur (2003 film)|''Ben Hur'' (2003 film)]], an animated direct-to-video film featuring the voice of Charlton Heston ** [[Ben Hur (TV miniseries)|''Ben Hur'' (TV miniseries)]], a television miniseries aired in 2010 ** [[Ben-Hur (play)|''Ben-Hur'' (play)]], a Broadway play ** Ben-Hur Museum, now renamed [[General Lew Wallace Study|General Lew Wallace Study & Museum]] ==Places== * [[Ben Hur, California]], an unincorporated community in Mariposa County, California * [[Ben Hur, Texas]], a town * Ben-Hur, a settlement in the district capital of the [[Kalahari Constituency]], Namibia * [[Ben Hur, Virginia]], an unincorporated community in Lee County, Virginia ==People== * [[Ben-Hur Baz]] (1906â€“2003), a Mexico painter of pin-up art * [[Ben-Hur Moreira Peres]] (born 1977), a Brazilian football midfielder * [[Benhur Salimbangon]] (born 1945), a Filipino politician * [[Ben Hur Villanueva]], a Filipino sculptor ==Other uses== * [[Club Sportivo Ben Hur]], a chain of sports clubs in Argentina * [[Ben Hur (automobile)]], an early car * [[Ben Hur trailer]], a nickname for the WWII G-518 One Ton Army trailer * Ben-Hur Coffee, early 20th Century brand which was sold in Southern California. * [[Tribe of Ben-Hur]] - an authorized fraternal order based on the book, later an insurance company ==See also== * [[Hur (Bible)]] * {{lookfrom}} * {{intitle}} {{disambiguation|geo|given name}} [[Category:Hebrew given names]] [[Category:Spanish given names]]
